'''MyDefrag''' (a re-branded version of '''[[JkDefrag]]''', but now closed source) is a gratis [[Defragmentation|disk defragmenting utility]] for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]. This [[computer program]] was developed by Jeroen Kessels beginning in 2004.<ref>Information obtained from product release notes: history.txt file</ref>
'''MyDefrag''' (a re-branded version of '''[[JkDefrag]]''', but now closed source) is a gratis [[Defragmentation|disk defragmenting utility]] for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]. This [[computer program]] was developed by Jeroen Kessels beginning in 2004.<ref>Information obtained from product release notes: history.txt file</ref>

MyDefrag runs on the Windows 2000/XP/2003/Vista Operating Systems, and defragments both [[File Allocation Table|FAT]] and [[NTFS]] filesystems. It uses the standard Windows defragmentation [[API]] exclusively, so it is safe to use. User support is provided through web-based forums.
MyDefrag runs on the Windows 2000/XP/2003/Vista Operating Systems, and defragments both [[File Allocation Table|FAT]] and [[NTFS]] filesystems. It uses the standard Windows defragmentation [[API]] exclusively, so it is safe to use. User support is provided through web-based forums.
â   â
== Related software ==
  â   â
There are several [[GUI|graphical user interface]] utilities designed to work with the old version of MyDefrag, JkDefrag.
  â   â
* ''JKDefrag Option GUI'' by Emiel Wieldraaijer includes support for 26 languages, and has additional support for [[BartPE]] and U3 implementations.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.freewaregenius.com/2007/07/31/jkdefrag-gui/ | title=JkDefrag GUI | work=Software Genius |date=July 2007}}</ref> It was also nominated "Repair Tool of the Week" in ''TechNibble'' in August 2007.<ref>http://www.technibble.com/repair-tool-of-the-week-jkdefrag-gui/</ref>
  â
* ''JkDefragGUI'' by Markus HÃ¶rl is portable, includes support for 10(+30) languages, and there is a setup version.
  â
* ''ScanDefrag'' supports JkDefrag and allows it to run early on during Windows startup.
